artist: Artist: Tsukioka Yoshitoshi; Publisher: Ōmiya Kyūjirō
catalogue_raissonne: Keyes, Courage and Silence (1982), no. 252; Iwakiri, Yoshitoshi (2014), p. 296.
creditline: The Mary Griggs Burke Endowment Fund established by the Mary Livingston Griggs and Mary Griggs Burke Foundation, gifts of various donors, by exchange, and gift of Edmond Freis in memory of his parents, Rose and Leon Freis
description: three sheets; cartoonish animal with long grey fur, large yellow eye, yellow teeth with long fangs and blue hooves at center, throwing off man men who are falling and flipping in every directions; men in URQ wear yellow furs (?); mountains in background covered in snow; snow in foreground, with snowballs flying in front of animal and figures
dimension: 14 5/8 × 9 9/16 in. (37.15 × 24.29 cm) (sheet, each, approx., vertical ōban triptych)
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
title: Yamamoto Kansuke Killing a Wild Boar
